RAMULUS nodded as he =
watched NIGHTSHIFT in pain, there was a reflected
pain in his own face. It =
was obvious that he hated to see one of his
companions in pain. Reaching in=
to his pack he brought out another
canister of something. =93This should he=
lp with the pain.=94

He began to administer the pain killer in the hopes t=
hat it would
allow NIGHTSHIFT to be more comfortable, perhaps even move. He=
 was
giving thought to calling in for back-up when he heard something
outsi=
de .    .    .

*thoom*     *thoom*     *thoom*

 .    .    .    Motioning =
to RAT TRAP and NIGHTSHIFT for silence
RAMULUS tried to listen, and what he=
 heard was the like the slow
steady beat of something =96 almost like a hum=
an heart beat.

*THOOM*     *THOOM*     *THOOM*

Looking around the cave RA=
MULUS didn=92t see anything that might be
causing it. Then he noticed the s=
ounds of the birds chirping and the
sounds of the background wild life had =
vanished, even the rustling of
ancient squerrels had stopped.

RAMULUS=92 o=
ptic fell on the standing pools of water that were towards
the front the ca=
ve they were in, remnants of the storm that had just
ended. They were rippl=
ing in response to the =91beats=92. The beats were
coming from =96outside- =
the cave.

=93Slag!=94 RAMULUS whispered quietly as he motioned his finding=
s to the
others. It was something walking and it was obviously something qu=
ite
large, and from the sound, it was approaching the very place they were
=
sitting in.
